natlang.rdg.documentplanner
Class InitialDocPlanBuilder

java.lang.Object
  natlang.rdg.documentplanner.InitialDocPlanBuilder
public class InitialDocPlanBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

InitialDocumentPlanBuilder is the first component of the DocumentPlanner and is responsible for the conversion of the fabula in OWL format into an initial document plan

Constructor Summary
InitialDocPlanBuilder()
          Constructor - creates the OWL Reasoning context and reads the fabula

transform

public boolean transform()
Starts the process of transforming the fabula into an initial document plan, and removes some plot elements if necessary (e.g. A -> P -> B)

Returns:
whether the transformation has ended successfully

getStartingNode

public jtp.fol.Symbol getStartingNode()
Returns the starting node of the fabula, which is the node with the lowest time argument

Returns:
the name of the starting node

createTreeOwl

public RSVertex createTreeOwl(jtp.fol.Symbol curr,
                              jtp.fol.Symbol prev,
                              RSVertex v,
                              boolean forward)
Converts the fabula structure into an initial document plan recursively

Parameters:
curr - the name of the node currently to be added to the document plan
prev - the name of the last node added to the document plan
v - the document plan generated sofar
forward - a boolean indicating whether the tree is to be created forwards or backwards
Returns:
the document plan

precedes

public boolean precedes(jtp.fol.Symbol n,
                        RSVertex v)
Checks whether plot element n happens before all plot elements used in v

Parameters:
n - the name of the current plot element
v - the branch that should appear before or after n
Returns:
whether n precedes all plot elements in v

public java.lang.String getType(jtp.fol.Symbol s)

Returns:
vector with arguments

createSubPlotElement

public PlotElement createSubPlotElement(java.util.Vector args)
Creates a sub plot element based on the elements in the Vector. The function first finds the relation that holds between the arguments and then creates a settings plot element for this relation and its arguments.

getCorrectstring

public java.lang.String getCorrectstring(jtp.fol.Symbol n,
                                         boolean nr)
Translates the name of the plot element used in the fabula structure into the name of the plot element that can be used in the Narrator. This can be achieved by removing the namespace and removing the substring "ind_" and ".plop". Furthermore the function checks if a hasInterpretation has been specified, in which case the correct name will be stored. Finally, based on the argument nr the time is added to the name or not.

Parameters:
n - the name to be converted into the correct string
nr - boolean indicating whether the id should be included in the name
Returns:
the simplified name

removeMessages

public void removeMessages()
Initializes the search for the nodes to be removed from the document plan

transformDepthFirst

public java.util.Vector transformDepthFirst(RSVertex v,
                                            java.util.Vector rem)
Checks the document plan recursively in order to find out which plot elements should be removed. Currently this only includes an outcome and the perception and belief that an action has succeeded (which can be achieved by checking if three consecutive plot elements represent an action, a perception and a belief and removing the perception and the belief). This may be extended to remove supergoals as well, in case the subgoal is a specialization of the supergoal (e.g. Plop wilde iets eten -> Plop wilde een appel eten, in this case the supergoal may be removed)

Parameters:
v - the document plan
rem - the nodes to be removed
Returns:
a vector containing the names of the nodes to be removed

removeMessage

public void removeMessage(PlotElement pe)
Removes the nodes from the document plan (is somewhat strange, but is the same as the function in Backgroundinformationsupplier)

Parameters:
pe - the node to be removed

getRelation

public java.lang.String getRelation(jtp.fol.Symbol m1,
                                    jtp.fol.Symbol m2)
Retrieves the relation between two plot elements from the fabula structure

Parameters:
m1 - name of the first plot element
m2 - name of the second plot element
Returns:
the relation between m1 and m2

Checks whether the plot element has already been added to the document plan

Parameters:
m - the name of the plot element
Returns:
true if m has been added to the document plan, false otherwise
